name: Premium Red Palm Oil
desc: Pure unrefined red palm oil, rich in nutrients and perfect for traditional Nigerian cooking.

name: Palm Oil 5L Canister
desc: Value-size pure red palm oil for the whole family. Ideal for large portions of egusi or banga soup.

name: Palm Kernel Oil
desc: Cold-pressed palm kernel oil, great for soups, cooking and traditional remedies.

name: Dried Catfish (Eja Aro)
desc: Smoked and sun-dried catfish, essential for pepper soup, egusi, and many Nigerian stews.

name: Whole Dried Catfish Large
desc: Premium large whole dried catfish. Deeply smoky flavour perfect for banga soup and ofe onugbu.

name: Ground Crayfish (Ijeba)
desc: Finely ground dried crayfish — adds authentic depth to any Nigerian soup or stew.

name: Whole Dried Crayfish
desc: Sun-dried whole crayfish with intense umami flavour. A pantry staple for every Nigerian kitchen.

name: Dried Snail (Eju)
desc: Premium quality dried snails, a delicacy used in pepper soup, nkwobi and ofe akwu.

name: Dried Stockfish (Okporoko)
desc: Air-dried Norwegian stockfish, a must-have for Igbo soups and Yoruba stews alike.

name: White Garri (Fine)
desc: Light and fluffy white garri, perfect for soaking with groundnuts, cold water, and sugar or swallow.

name: Red Garri (Ijebu Garri)
desc: Coarse and tangy Ijebu-style red garri. Perfect with cold water and sugar — a nostalgic favourite.

name: Egusi (Melon Seeds)
desc: Ground melon seeds for the most delicious egusi soup. Rich, nutty, and full of protein.

name: Whole Egusi Seeds
desc: Raw whole egusi seeds. Grind fresh at home for the best flavour in your soups.

name: Uziza Leaves (Dried)
desc: Dried uziza leaves with a peppery and slightly bitter flavour. Essential for ofe onugbu and pepper soup.

name: Ogiri (Fermented Locust Bean)
desc: Traditional fermented seasoning used in egusi, oha, and bitterleaf soups for deep umami taste.

name: Iru / Dawadawa (Locust Beans)
desc: Whole fermented locust beans for authentic Yoruba soups and stews.

name: Ehuru (Calabash Nutmeg)
desc: Dried calabash nutmeg seeds — a key spice for pepper soup and ofe owerri.

name: Chin Chin (Crunchy)
desc: Golden, crunchy Nigerian chin chin fried to perfection. A satisfying bite-sized snack for all ages.

name: Fried Groundnuts
desc: Lightly salted fried groundnuts — the perfect partner for your garri or just as a snack.

name: Bonga Fish (Smoked)
desc: Heavily smoked bonga fish, adding a signature smoky taste to jollof rice, stews and soups.

name: Oha Leaves (Dried)
desc: Sun-dried oha leaves for the classic Igbo oha soup. Mild, earthy and incredibly aromatic.

name: Dried Bitterleaf
desc: Dried bitterleaf for ofe onugbu (bitter leaf soup). Pre-washed and easy to use.

name: Ogbono Seeds
desc: Wild mango seeds ground for silky, draw ogbono soup. Packed with iron and fibre.

name: Dried Ede Cocoyam Flour
desc: Cocoyam flour for thickening oha and bitterleaf soups the traditional Igbo way.
